title: Step 1: Understanding the Equation
text: We have a linear regression equation of the form $$y=a x+b$$. In this equation, 'a' is the slope and 'b' is the intercept. Think of 'x' as the diameter of the tree, and 'y' as the predicted age.

title: Step 2: Inputting the Values
text: Now that we have the equation, $$y=6.301x-1.044$$, replace 'x' with the diameter of the tree, which is $$10$$ inches. Go ahead and plug in the values!

title: Reflect on the Slope
text: The slope, $$a=6.301$$, tells us how much the age increases with every additional inch in diameter. What does this value tell you about the relationship between diameter and age of the trees?

title: Review the Correlation
text: Notice that the correlation coefficient, $$r=-0.970$$, is close to $$-1$$, indicating a strong negative linear relationship. This means as the diameter of the tree increases, what can you infer about its age?
